name: Edwards's Fig Parrot
description: Adults are predominantly green with red cheeks, a yellowish crown, and yellow ear coverts. Males have a red breast with a dark blue band, while females have a greenish-yellow breast with a wider blue band.
food_note: Fruits, especially figs, nectar, sometimes insects
image_alt: Edwards's Fig Parrot, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
proportions: Length 18 cm; tail length 4.7–6.3 cm; wing length 10.3–11.8 cm; weight 105 g
reproduction: Lays 2–3 eggs; incubation lasts 19 days (data from captivity)
attractions: They fly quickly, usually in pairs or small, noisy flocks. To reach food, they often hang upside down in branches. They can be observed in large groups in treetops alongside other species.
breeding: We have kept them since 1997. The first successful breeding was recorded in 2003, followed by a break, with further young raised in 2011 and 2013.
